content.text:
<task>
The user pointed out that we missed **Kitty** terminal configuration.

Your task is to:
1.  **Check & Backup**: Verify if `~/.config/kitty/` exists. If so, copy the entire directory to `terminal_backup/.config/kitty/`.
2.  **Update `install.sh`**:
    *   Add a command to install Kitty: `sudo dnf install kitty -y`.
    *   Add a command to restore the config: `cp -r .config/kitty ~/.config/`.
3.  **Update `README.md`**: Add "Kitty" to the list of backed-up components.
4.  **Update Archive**: Re-create `terminal_backup.tar.gz` to include the new Kitty files and updated script.
5.  **Git Update**:
    *   Stage all changes (`git add .`).
    *   Commit with message "Add Kitty terminal configuration to backup".
    *   Push to `origin main`.
</task>

<file><path>terminal_backup/install.sh</path>
<content lines="1-165">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | 
  3 | # Terminal Setup Installer for Nobara 42 (Fedora-based)
  4 | # This script restores terminal configuration from backup
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
  9 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 10 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 11 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 12 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 13 | 
 14 | echo -e "${GREEN}=== Terminal Setup Installer for Nobara 42 ===${NC}"
 15 | echo ""
 16 | 
 17 | # Function to print status
 18 | print_status() {
 19 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[✓]${NC} $1"
 20 | }
 21 | 
 22 | print_warning() {
 23 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[!]${NC} $1"
 24 | }
 25 | 
 26 | print_error() {
 27 |     echo -e "${RED}[✗]${NC} $1"
 28 | }
 29 | 
 30 | # 1. System Update
 31 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Updating system...${NC}"
 32 | sudo dnf update -y
 33 | print_status "System updated"
 34 | 
 35 | # 2. Install Core Tools
 36 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing core tools...${NC}"
 37 | sudo dnf install -y zsh git curl wget util-linux-user
 38 | print_status "Core tools installed (zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user)"
 39 | 
 40 | # 3. Install Terminal Tools
 41 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing terminal tools...${NC}"
 42 | 
 43 | # Starship
 44 | if sudo dnf install -y starship 2>/dev/null; then
 45 |     print_status "Starship installed via dnf"
 46 | else
 47 |     print_warning "Starship not in repos, installing via official script..."
 48 |     curl -sS https://starship.rs/install.sh | sh -s -- -y
 49 |     print_status "Starship installed via official script"
 50 | fi
 51 | 
 52 | # Atuin
 53 | if sudo dnf install -y atuin 2>/dev/null; then
 54 |     print_status "Atuin installed via dnf"
 55 | else
 56 |     print_warning "Atuin not in repos, installing via official script..."
 57 |     curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://setup.atuin.sh | sh
 58 |     print_status "Atuin installed via official script"
 59 | fi
 60 | 
 61 | # Fastfetch
 62 | sudo dnf install -y fastfetch
 63 | print_status "Fastfetch installed"
 64 | 
 65 | # 4. Install Zsh Plugins
 66 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing Zsh plugins...${NC}"
 67 | sudo dnf install -y zsh-autosuggestions zsh-syntax-highlighting
 68 | print_status "zsh-autosuggestions and zsh-syntax-highlighting installed"
 69 | 
 70 | # zsh-autocomplete - check if available in repos or clone from GitHub
 71 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM="/usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh"
 72 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL="$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins/zsh-autocomplete"
 73 | 
 74 | if sudo dnf install -y zsh-autocomplete 2>/dev/null && [ -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]; then
 75 |     print_status "zsh-autocomplete installed via dnf"
 76 | else
 77 |     print_warning "zsh-autocomplete not in repos, cloning from GitHub..."
 78 |     mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins"
 79 |     if [ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]; then
 80 |         rm -rf "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 81 |     fi
 82 |     git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete.git "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 83 |     print_status "zsh-autocomplete cloned to $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
 84 | fi
 85 | 
 86 | # 5. Restore Config Files
 87 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Restoring configuration files...${NC}"
 88 | 
 89 | # .zshrc
 90 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.zshrc" ]; then
 91 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.zshrc" ~/
 92 |     
 93 |     # Update zsh-autocomplete path if using local installation
 94 |     if [ ! -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ] && [ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]; then
 95 |         sed -i "s|source /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|source $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|g" ~/.zshrc
 96 |         print_status ".zshrc copied and updated with local zsh-autocomplete path"
 97 |     else
 98 |         print_status ".zshrc copied"
 99 |     fi
100 | fi
101 | 
102 | # .bashrc
103 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.bashrc" ]; then
104 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.bashrc" ~/
105 |     print_status ".bashrc copied"
106 | fi
107 | 
108 | # Create .config directory if it doesn't exist
109 | mkdir -p ~/.config
110 | 
111 | # starship.toml
112 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ]; then
113 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ~/.config/
114 |     print_status "starship.toml copied"
115 | elif [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ]; then
116 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ~/.config/
117 |     print_status "starship.toml copied"
118 | fi
119 | 
120 | # atuin config
121 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/atuin" ]; then
122 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/atuin
123 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/atuin/"* ~/.config/atuin/
124 |     print_status "atuin config copied"
125 | fi
126 | 
127 | # fastfetch config
128 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ]; then
129 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fastfetch
130 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fastfetch/"* ~/.config/fastfetch/
131 |     print_status "fastfetch config copied"
132 | fi
133 | 
134 | # fish config
135 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fish" ]; then
136 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fish
137 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fish/"* ~/.config/fish/
138 |     print_status "fish config copied"
139 | fi
140 | 
141 | # 6. Restore Fonts
142 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing fonts...${NC}"
143 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/fonts" ]; then
144 |     mkdir -p ~/.local/share/fonts
145 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/fonts/"*.ttf ~/.local/share/fonts/ 2>/dev/null || true
146 |     fc-cache -fv
147 |     print_status "Fonts installed and cache updated"
148 | else
149 |     print_warning "No fonts directory found in backup"
150 | fi
151 | 
152 | # 7. Set Default Shell to Zsh
153 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Setting default shell to zsh...${NC}"
154 | if [ "$SHELL" != "$(which zsh)" ]; then
155 |     chsh -s "$(which zsh)"
156 |     print_status "Default shell changed to zsh (will take effect on next login)"
157 | else
158 |     print_status "Zsh is already the default shell"
159 | fi
160 | 
161 | echo ""
162 | echo -e "${GREEN}=== Installation Complete! ===${NC}"
163 | echo ""
164 | echo "Please log out and log back in for the shell change to take effect."
165 | echo "Then open a new terminal to enjoy your restored setup!"
</content>
</file>
<file><path>README.md</path>
<content lines="1-86">
 1 | # Terminal Configuration & Migration
 2 | 
 3 | A backup of my custom terminal setup intended for easy migration to Nobara 42 (Fedora-based).
 4 | 
 5 | ## Description
 6 | 
 7 | This repository contains configuration files, fonts, and an automated installation script to quickly restore a fully-featured terminal environment featuring:
 8 | 
 9 | - **Zsh** - Modern shell with powerful features
10 | - **Starship** - Cross-shell prompt with extensive customization
11 | - **Atuin** - Magical shell history with sync capabilities
12 | - **Fastfetch** - System information display tool
13 | - **Nerd Fonts** - Patched fonts with icon support (CaskaydiaCove, FiraCode, JetBrains Mono)
14 | 
15 | ## Contents
16 | 
17 | ```
18 | terminal_backup/
19 | ├── .zshrc                    # Zsh configuration
20 | ├── .bashrc                   # Bash configuration (backup)
21 | ├── .config/                  # Application configs (starship, atuin, fastfetch)
22 | ├── fonts/                    # Nerd Fonts collection
23 | ├── install.sh                # Automated installation script
24 | └── restore_instructions.txt  # Manual plugin installation guide
25 | ```
26 | 
27 | ## Quick Start
28 | 
29 | ### Automated Installation (Recommended)
30 | 
31 | 1. Clone the repository:
32 |    ```bash
33 |    git clone <repo-url> systems-migration
34 |    cd systems-migration
35 |    ```
36 | 
37 | 2. Navigate to the backup directory:
38 |    ```bash
39 |    cd terminal_backup
40 |    ```
41 | 
42 | 3. Run the installation script:
43 |    ```bash
44 |    chmod +x install.sh
45 |    ./install.sh
46 |    ```
47 | 
48 | 4. Log out and log back in for the shell change to take effect.
49 | 
50 | The script will:
51 | - Update the system
52 | - Install Zsh, Starship, Atuin, and Fastfetch
53 | - Install Zsh plugins (autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting, autocomplete)
54 | - Restore all configuration files
55 | - Install fonts and refresh font cache
56 | - Set Zsh as the default shell
57 | 
58 | ## Manual Installation
59 | 
60 | If you prefer manual installation or need to customize the setup:
61 | 
62 | 1. Copy configuration files manually to their respective locations:
63 |    - `.zshrc` → `~/`
64 |    - `.bashrc` → `~/`
65 |    - `.config/*` → `~/.config/`
66 |    - `fonts/*.ttf` → `~/.local/share/fonts/`
67 | 
68 | 2. Install required Zsh plugins - see [`restore_instructions.txt`](terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt) for details.
69 | 
70 | 3. Refresh font cache:
71 |    ```bash
72 |    fc-cache -fv
73 |    ```
74 | 
75 | 4. Change default shell:
76 |    ```bash
77 |    chsh -s $(which zsh)
78 |    ```
79 | 
80 | ## Screenshots
81 | 
82 | *Add screenshots here*
83 | 
84 | ## License
85 | 
86 | Personal configuration backup - use at your own discretion.
</content>
</file>
</files>
